channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-21489] EXPLAIN command throws ClassCastException in Hive
item.description:
I'm trying to run commands like explain select * from src in hive-2.3.4,but it falls with the ClassCastException: org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.parse.ExplainSemanticAnalyzer cannot be cast to org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.parse.SemanticAnalyzer
Steps to reproduce:
1）hive.execution.engine is the default value mr
2）hive.security.authorization.enabled is set to true, and hive.security.authorization.manager is set to org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.authorization.DefaultHiveAuthorizationProvider
3）start hivecli to run command：explain select * from src
I debug the code and find the issue HIVE-18778 causing the above ClassCastException.If I set hive.in.test to true，the explain command can be successfully executed。
Now,I have one question,due to hive.in.test cann't be modified at runtime.how to run explain command with using default authorization in hive-2.3.4,
item.summary: EXPLAIN command throws ClassCastException in Hive

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: daijy,thejas hello~ can you please spend some time to look at my problem，thank you so much.

xuefuz xuanhua hi~ due to hive.in.test cann't be modified at runtime.how to run explain command with using default authorization in hive-2.3.4，or the default authorization can't be used in hive-2.3.4?
HIVE-18778 does push the execution path to a bug in getTablePartitionUsedColumns, which does not access ExplainSemanticAnalyzer. Attach patch.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12966007 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Ping Lu, the patch would fix the issue of explain when DefaultHiveAuthorizationProvider is configured. However, DefaultHiveAuthorizationProvider is deprecated and you shall go with SQLStdHiveAuthorizerFactory (set hive.security.authorization.manager=org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.authorization.plugin.sqlstd.SQLStdHiveAuthorizerFactory). If you have to use DefaultHiveAuthorizationProvider, you can apply the patch and rebuild. But I won't commit the patch to master as we intend to remove DefaultHiveAuthorizationProvider in future.
daijyThanks for your attention! The solution you gave me is very helpful. In addition, I will accept your suggestion and try SQLStdHiveAuthorizerFactory in the Hive-2.X version.

Ping Lu daijy

The same error happens when Hive is configured for Storage Base Authorization.

<property>
   <name>hive.security.authorization.enabled</name>
   <value>true</value>
 </property>
 <property>
   <name>hive.security.metastore.authorization.manager</name>
   <value>org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.authorization.StorageBasedAuthorizationProvider</value>
 </property>
 <property>
   <name>hive.security.authorization.manager</name>
   <value>org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.authorization.StorageBasedAuthorizationProvider</value>
 </property>
 <property>
   <name>hive.security.metastore.authenticator.manager</name>
   <value>org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.HadoopDefaultMetastoreAuthenticator</value>
 </property>
 <property>
   <name>hive.metastore.pre.event.listeners</name>
   <value>org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.authorization.AuthorizationPreEventListener</value>
 </property>

FAILED: ClassCastException org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.parse.ExplainSemanticAnalyzer cannot be cast to org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.parse.SemanticAnalyzer

So the patch is valid. Please commit to the master.
I've tested the patched and it works for Storage Base Authorization as well.

daijy This issue can still be reproduced if it is Storage based Authorization and it will be better if we can fix this. The above patch seems to be reasonable for me. 

cc hashutosh thejas

Resolved via https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/2373
Thanks rameshkumar for the patch!
